issue.title: [Python] Address docstrings in Filesystems (Python Implementations)
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-16093](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-16093). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
Ensure docstrings for Filesystem Interface have an `Examples` section:
 \* <https://arrow.apache.org/docs/python/generated/pyarrow.fs.PyFileSystem.html#pyarrow.fs.PyFileSystem>
 \* <https://arrow.apache.org/docs/python/generated/pyarrow.fs.FileSystemHandler.html#pyarrow.fs.FileSystemHandler>
 \* <https://arrow.apache.org/docs/python/generated/pyarrow.fs.FSSpecHandler.html#pyarrow.fs.FSSpecHandler>

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-16093?focusedCommentId=17565499) by @toddfarmer:*
This issue was last updated over 90 days ago, which may be an indication it is no longer being actively worked. To better reflect the current state, the issue is being unassigned. Please feel free to re-take assignment of the issue if it is being actively worked, or if you plan to start that work soon.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-16093?focusedCommentId=17568668) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
Issue resolved by pull request 13595
<https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13595>
